What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was

What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved

Comments_List: How fundamental organometallic transformations occur. In what ways it can be applied to other areas like organic chemistry and green chemistry.
It was very interesting, especially learning about the blunders and other insight into how the chemistry research world works.
Basics of organometallic chemistry as well as some history of the field
General organometallic chemistry principles and applications to synthetic chemistry.
I now have a deeper appreciation for the role of transition metals as they apply to catalytic cycles. Additionally, I learned a lot about the scientific community through Prof. Crabtree's anecdotes.
I learned a lot about the history and development of the organometallic field
In-depth fundamentals of organometallic chemistry and an introduction to a wide spread of applications.
Electron counting and organometallic reaction mechanisms.
lots of knowledge about organometallic chemistry and advanced research area about catalyst
Knowledge of organometallic chemistry
Very homogenous course: it was simply lecture, which you didn't need to go to because he reads off slides that he posts. No other assessments besides 2-3 exams.
Interesting course, and fair exams
The lectures were interesting and engaging, if sometimes a bit wandering and unfocused.
Strength/weakness: The lecture slides were very long but sometimes lacked detail. It could easily be augmented by following along with the book.
I would like to have problem sets to practice and get feedback on answers.
This course was very thorough. I would have liked to have had more opportunities to get feedback throughout the semester. Perhaps in future years problem sets could be assigned.
It was really easy to not do anything for the course until it was time to study for the exam. Some graded problem sets would have been helpful.

The course gets a little dry after the second exam, but otherwise was informative and entertaining. Maybe have extra example questions or optional but recommended problem sets other than those from the book, especially for the later chapters.
strengths: Prof. Crabtree is knowledgeable. He knows almost everything in organometallics. He is a great instructor, not only imparting knowledge, but also telling us how to do research.
Far too much course material, exams didn't feel entirely representative of book problems or the material discussed in class.
Yeah, probably. Didn't love it because it was simple lecture and 2 exams. Little opportunity to practice concepts.
Yes. If you think you'll be working with metals in your research (even tangentially), this course provides useful information
Yes.   Essentially for anyone wanting to do synthetic chemistry.
I would recommend this course simply because it is taught by Bob.
Yes, the course is very fair in its grading scheme, organometallic chemistry has ingrained in other subdivisions of chemistry, and the course has a good instructor.
Yes, it is a very fundamental course for chemistry.
Yes. It is a good class for graduate student who wants to learn something about organometallics. After learning this course, I can understand the literature in this area.
